member.name: IXAPO.CalcInputFrames
member.summary: Returns the number of input frames required to generate the given number of output frames.
member.param: The number of output frames desired.
member.returns: Returns the number of input frames required.

member.name: IXAPO.CalcOutputFrames
member.summary: Returns the number of output frames that will be generated from a given number of input frames.
member.returns: Returns the number of output frames that will be produced.

member.name: IXAPO.GetRegistrationProperties
member.summary: Returns the registration properties of an XAPO.
member.param: Receives a pointer to a structure containing the registration properties the XAPO was created with; use to free the structure.
member.returns: Returns S_OK if successful; returns an error code otherwise.

member.name: IXAPO.Initialize
member.param: Effect-specific initialization parameters, may be NULL if DataByteSize is 0.
Size of pData in bytes, may be 0 if pData is NULL.
member.returns: Returns S_OK if successful, an error code otherwise.

member.name: IXAPO.IsInputFormatSupported
member.summary: Queries if a specific input format is supported for a given output format.
member.param: Input format to check for being supported.

If not NULL, and the input format is not supported for the given output format, ppSupportedInputFormat returns a pointer to the closest input format that is supported. Use to free the returned structure.
member.returns: Returns S_OK if the format pair is supported. Returns XAPO_E_FORMAT_UNSUPPORTED if the format pair is not supported.

member.name: IXAPO.IsOutputFormatSupported
member.summary: Queries if a specific output format is supported for a given input format.
member.param: Output format to check for being supported.

If not NULL and the output format is not supported for the given input format, ppSupportedOutputFormat returns a pointer to the closest output format that is supported. Use to free the returned structure.
member.returns: Returns S_OK if the format pair is supported. Returns XAPO_E_FORMAT_UNSUPPORTED if the format pair is not supported.

member.name: IXAPO.LockForProcess
member.summary: Called by XAudio2 to lock the input and output configurations of an XAPO allowing it to do any final initialization before is called on the realtime thread.
member.param: Number of elements in ppInputLockedParameters. Must be within the .MinInputBufferCount and XAPO_REGISTRATION_PROPERTIES.MaxInputBufferCount values passed to .
Array of input structures. pInputLockedParameters may be NULL if InputLockedParameterCount is 0, otherwise it must have InputLockedParameterCount elements.

Number of elements in ppOutputLockedParameters. Must be within the .MinOutputBufferCount and XAPO_REGISTRATION_PROPERTIES.MaxOutputBufferCount values passed to . If the XAPO_FLAG_BUFFERCOUNT_MUST_MATCH flag was specified in XAPO_REGISTRATION_PROPERTIES.Flags then OutputLockedParameterCount must equal InputLockedParameterCount.
Array of output structures. pOutputLockedParameters may be NULL if OutputLockedParameterCount is 0, otherwise it must have OutputLockedParameterCount elements.
member.returns: Returns S_OK if successful, an error code otherwise.

member.name: IXAPO.Process
member.summary: Runs the XAPO's digital signal processing (DSP) code on the given input and output buffers.

param.name: InputProcessParameterCount
param.div: Note XAudio2 currently supports only one input stream and one output stream.

param.name: OutputProcessParameterCount
param.div: Note XAudio2 currently supports only one input stream and one output stream.

member.param: Output array of structures. On input, the value of XAPO_PROCESS_BUFFER_PARAMETERS. ValidFrameCount indicates the number of frames that the XAPO should write to the output buffer. On output, the value of XAPO_PROCESS_BUFFER_PARAMETERS. ValidFrameCount indicates the actual number of frames written.
TRUE to process normally; FALSE to process thru. See Remarks for additional information.

member.name: IXAPO.Reset
member.summary: Resets variables dependent on frame history.

member.name: IXAPO.UnlockForProcess
member.summary: Deallocates variables that were allocated with the method.

member.name: IXAPO
member.summary: The interface for an Audio Processing Object which be used in an XAudio2 effect chain.
